articles.title: ‘Superhero’ runners to sweep through Boston Marathon’s final 17 miles
articles.description:
The annual SuperHero17 training run returns Saturday with colorful costumes – and a heartfelt tribute to its late founder.

The post ‘Superhero’ runners to sweep through Boston Marathon’s final 17 miles appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: SuperHero17 training run returns on Saturday, honoring late founder Susan Hurley.
Runners will don colorful costumes while covering the final 17 miles of the Boston Marathon.
Event fosters community spirit and encourages local participation in marathon training.

articles.title: Should pajamas be banned at Logan Airport?
articles.description:
"The madness stops today. The movement starts now."

The post Should pajamas be banned at Logan Airport? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: A movement to ban pajamas at Logan Airport has been initiated by local residents.
The campaign aims to address concerns about airport dress codes and public image.
Potential changes could affect travelers' comfort and airport regulations in Boston.

articles.title: Sullivan’s Castle Island reopens for the 2026 season
articles.description:
Get your hot dogs, fries, and seagull encounters now that Sullivan's Castle Island has opened for spring.

The post Sullivan’s Castle Island reopens for the 2026 season appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Sullivan's Castle Island reopens for the 2026 season, welcoming visitors for spring.
Enjoy classic menu items like hot dogs and fries starting February 27, 2026.
Local residents can now enjoy outdoor dining and scenic views at Castle Island.

articles.title: Court doc: N.H. country club shooter said he chose location to target rich people
articles.description:
Hunter Nadeau allegedly told Nashua police he was “tired of the ‘elites’ taking all the money.”

The post Court doc: N.H. country club shooter said he chose location to target rich people appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Hunter Nadeau targeted a New Hampshire country club to attack wealthy individuals.
Nadeau expressed frustration with 'elites' taking money during police questioning.
The incident raises concerns about safety at local affluent venues for Boston residents.
